extensionDescription.message: Your browser is now set up to use I2P.

extensionStatus.message: It is a labs project for enhancing your I2P browsing experience.

controlExplain.message: These controls are used to tailor your I2P Browsing Experience

clearDesc.message: Use this to erase your I2P browsing data.

rtcDesc.message: WebRTC is disabled by default, but you can turn it back on and force it to honor the proxy. If you are a user of the Snowflake browser extension, this option is disabled and WebRTC is turned on by default.

histDesc.message: History is automatically cleared when your I2P tabs are closed. If you want to clear history as you go, check this box.

applicationExplain.message: These applications work with I2P directly to provide them with security and privacy.

routerConsole.message: The entrypoint for all other I2P applications is the I2P Router Console. To visit it, click here.

windowVisitHomepage.description: Home page for the extension label.

abouthome.message: For more information about this extension, visit this page.
abouthome.description: Description for the extension button page.

windowVisitHelppage.description: Help page for the extension label.

help.message: For more information about this extension, visit this page.
help.description: Description for the extension button page.

i2ptunnel.message: I2P has a web-based interface for configuring .i2p services like web sites which you can set up.

susimail.message: I2P also bundles a webmail client which can be used to access in-I2P e-mail.

snark.message: I2P is capable of anonymous Peer-to-Peer file sharing using the built-in bittorrent application.

sources.description: Description for the Source code link

resetMessage.description: Message for the Reset Tunnel button

infoMessage.message: You are now free to browse the eepWeb! Your browser is now configured to browse anonymously on the I2P network. As you browse, your traffic will be routed through other network nodes to disguise it's origin, both from the server and from the nodes themselves.

newsMessage.message: Visit the I2P Blog to learn the latest about i2p.

forumMessage.message: Visit the I2P Forum to learn more or ask for assistance

proxyHelpText.description: Help for configuring the options for the Reset Tunnel button

hostText.description: Host for the HTTP or SOCKS5 Proxy

portText.description: Port for the HTTP or SOCKS5 Proxy

controlHelpText.description: Help for configuring the options for the Reset Tunnel button

isBase32.description: Message for site info panel base32

isHostName.description: Message for the site info panel hostname

certAbsent.message: This site is not using HTTPS. It is still verified cryptographically by I2P.
certAbsent.description: Content for certificate info if absent

certPresent.message: This site is using HTTPS. HTTPS over I2P is experimental and requires self-signed certificates or alternate root authorites.
certPresent.description: Content for certificate info if present

protocolHandlerValue.description: Value for the magnet protocol handler
